resources:
// Week 1
// Monday
original_workout_week_one_workout~The Basics (Rounds For Time)~ Beginners:1-2 Rounds
 Intermediate: 2-3 Rounds
 Advanced: 4-5 Rounds

 1. Push-Ups or Knee Push-Ups (10x)
 2. Sit-Ups or Crunches (10x)
 3. Pull-Ups or Australian Pull-Ups (10x)
 4. Squats or Chair Squats (10x)

 Post Workout: Core and Stretch
// Tuesday
NA~Turn It Up Tuesday: Aerobic Day or Active Rest Day~Using smart training practices means respecting one’s rest periods. That means, for one’s “Fast Twitch” muscle fibers (the target with our main workouts), joints and nervous system to recover optimally, a rest day or two is needed. However, rest days don’t have to be lazy days. In fact, active rest targeting “Slow Twitch” muscle fibers (which aerobic activity does) is a great change-up for burning calories and promoting recovery. This on top of mobility and flexibility practices makes an ideal, in-between workout day.


Choose from the following:
 Running, biking, hiking, stairs, swimming, basketball, soccer, frisbee, another sport, rock climbing, jumping jacks, burpees, high knees, skiing, cross-country skiing, snow shoeing, hopscotch, bear crawls, playing with the kids or whatever keeps you moving for…
 Intermediate: 12 minutes / Advanced: 15 minutes


Post Workout: Core and Stretch:
 Pick at least 6 stretches and hold for 20-30 seconds each. It’s okay to go through the stretch series a couple of times. For an amazing post-workout stretch bonus, try foam rolling. This is the perfect recovery enhancer and can be done anywhere (even if you do not own a foam roller (check out foam rolling on Dr. Oz earlier this year!)


If you typically get sore after workouts, stretching immediately after a workout will help alleviate some of this. As well, stretching POST-workout will help prevent injury, speed up muscle recovery and enhance overall fitness level. Go to the stretching section to get started on this recovery practice.


Feel free to ask questions below, or in the community area. We would love to hear your feedback, as well as see group interaction.
// Wednesday
NA~5 Minute Fat Burner~*No equipment needed


Intermediate: 5 minutes(As Many Rounds As Possible)
 Advanced: 8 minutes(As Many Rounds As Possible)


1) Bear Crawl 5-10 feet forward
 2) 5 Burpees
 3) Bear Crawl 5-10 feet backward
 4) 5 Burpees



Core workout from the tab
 Fitness Challenge:
 Complete Exercises For Time:


1) 30 squats
 2) 30 jumping jacks
 3) 30 sit ups
 4) 30 push-ups


Stretch and Cool Down Post Workout:
 * Pick at least 6 stretches from the Stretch Tab and hold for 20-30 seconds each. It’s okay to go through the stretch series a couple times. For an amazing post-workout stretch bonus, try foam rolling. This is the perfect recovery enhancer and can be done anywhere (even if you do not own a foam roller (check out foam rolling on Dr. Oz earlier this year!)


// Thursday
NA~Aerobic Day~Choose from the following: Running, biking, hiking, stairs, swimming, basketball, soccer, frisbee, another sport, rock climbing, jumping jacks, burpees, high knees, skiing, cross-country skiing, snow shoeing, hopscotch, bear crawls, playing with the kids or whatever keeps you moving for…
 Intermediate: 12 minutes / Advanced: 15 Minutes

 Post Workout: Core and Stretch:
 Pick at least 6 stretches and hold for 20-30 seconds each.


// Friday
original_workout_week_one_workout~The Basics (Rounds For Time)~ Beginners:1-2 Rounds
 Intermediate: 2-3 Rounds
 Advanced: 4-5 Rounds

 1. Push-Ups or Knee Push-Ups (10x)
 2. Sit-Ups or Crunches (10x)
 3. Pull-Ups or Australian Pull-Ups (10x)
 4. Squats or Chair Squats (10x)

 Post Workout: Core and Stretch
// Saturday
NA~Active Rest Day~Today is the perfect day to go for a walk, hike or family activity. You can also do the Dynamic Warm-Up, Foam Roll and stretch to loosen up your muscles. Keep it light today and let your muscles begin to repair. You will hit it hard on Monday.


Step 3: Stretch and Cool Down:
 * Pick at least 6 stretches from the Stretch Tab and hold for 20-30 seconds each.
// Week 2
// Monday
original_workout_week_two_workout~Let The Games Begin~ Intermediate: 3 Rounds
 Advanced: 4-5 Rounds


1. Single Leg Hip Bridge or Double Leg Hip Bridge (15x)
 2. Chair Dips (15x)
 3. Squat with Alternating Leg Kick or Chair Squat with Knee Bend (20x total)
 4. Sit-Ups with Medicine Ball or Crunches (20x)
 5. Plank with Side Toe Taps or Plank from knees (10x/side)
 6. Pull-Ups or Australian Pull-Ups (15x)


Post Workout: Core and Stretch
// Tuesday
NA~Turn It Up Tuesday: Aerobic Day or Active Rest Day~Using smart training practices means respecting one’s rest periods. That means, for one’s “Fast Twitch” muscle fibers (the target with our main workouts), joints and nervous system to recover optimally, a rest day or two is needed. // Wednesday
NA~Glute Workout~*No equipment needed


Intermediate: 3 Rounds
 Advanced: 4-5 Rounds


1. Hip Bridge or Single Leg Hip Bridge (15x)
 2. Glute Kickback (15x/side)
 3. Supermans (15x)
 4. Step Ups with Kickback (15x/side)
 5. Jump Squats or Squats (15x)



Core workout from the tab
 Fitness Challenge:
 Complete Exercises For Time:


1) 10 Jump Squats
 2) 20 Burpees
 3) 30 Squats
 4) 40 Bicycle Crunches


Stretch and Cool Down Post Workout:
 * Pick at least 6 stretches from the Stretch Tab and hold for 20-30 seconds each. It’s okay to go through the stretch series a couple times. For an amazing post-workout stretch bonus, try foam rolling. This is the perfect recovery enhancer and can be done anywhere (even if you do not own a foam roller (check out foam rolling on Dr. Oz earlier this year!)


// Thursday
NA~Aerobic Day~Choose from the following: Running, biking, hiking, stairs, swimming, basketball, soccer, frisbee, another sport, rock climbing, jumping jacks, burpees, high knees, skiing, cross-country skiing, snow shoeing, hopscotch, bear crawls, playing with the kids or whatever keeps you moving for…
 Intermediate: 15 minutes / Advanced: 18 Minutes

 Post Workout: Core and Stretch:

// Friday
original_workout_week_two_workout~Flashback Friday! Time To Beat Monday’s Score!~ Intermediate: 3 Rounds
 Advanced: 4-5 Rounds


1. Single Leg Hip Bridge or Double Leg Hip Bridge (15x)
 2. Chair Dips (15x)
 3. Squat with Alternating Leg Kick or Chair Squat with Knee Bend (20x total)
 4. Sit-Ups with Medicine Ball or Crunches (20x)
 5. Plank with Side Toe Taps or Plank from knees (10x/side)
 6. Pull-Ups or Australian Pull-Ups (15x)


Post Workout: Core and Stretch
// Saturday
NA~Sweat It Out Saturday/ Active Rest Day!~In case you missed it, Sweat It Out Satruday can either be Friday’s workout, an aerobic day, or if you are really sore, a recovery day. For the standard/recommended routine, do the following.


If you need a real light day, do the warm-up, walk, EXTRA stretching and foam rolling. Be sure to keep hydration up! If you’re feeling ready to go, complete the following:

Step 1: Warm-Up


Step 2: Cardio Workout:
 Choose from the following:
 Running, biking, hiking, stairs, swimming, basketball, soccer, frisbee, another sport, rock climbing, jumping jacks, burpees, high knees, skiing, cross-country skiing, snow shoeing, hopscotch, bear crawls, playing with the kids or whatever keeps you moving for…
 Intermediate: 15 minutes, Advanced: 18 minutes


Step 3: Core (From the Stretch/Core Tab)


Step 4: Stretch and Cool Down
// Week 3
// Monday
original_workout_week_three_workout~Let The Games Begin!~ Equipment Needed: Medicine Ball and Suspension Trainer
 Intermediate: 3 Rounds
 Advanced: 4-5 Rounds


1. Ball Slams or Squats/Chair Squats (10x)
 2. Pull-Ups or Australian Pull-Ups (10x)
 3. Ab Crunch (B:20x, I:40x, A:60x)
 4. Boxer Shuffle (B:20x, I:40x, A:60x)
 5. Plank Hold (B: 30 seconds, I: 45 seconds, A:60 seconds)


Post Workout: Core and Stretch

// Wednesday
NA~The Beach 8 Minute Meltdown~*No equipment needed


5 Different Exercises, 10 reps each with 8 minutes to get in As Many Rounds As Possible (AMRAP)


1. Crab Walk 10 Forward and 10 Backward
 2. Rocking plank (x10)
 3. Side Walks (x10 Each Way)
 4. 10 Push-Ups
 5. 10 Squats



Core workout from the tab
 Fitness Challenge:
 Complete Exercises For Time:


1. 10 Pushup-ups / 1 Sit-Up 2. 9 Push-Ups/ 2 Sit-Ups 3. 8 Push-Ups/ 3 Sit-Ups 4. 7 Push-Ups/ 4 Sit-Ups 5. 6 Push-Ups/ 5 Sit-Ups 6. 5 Push-Ups/ 6 Sit-Ups 7. 4 Push-Ups/ 7 Sit-Ups 8. 3 Push-Ups/ 8 Sit-Ups 9. 2 Push-Ups/ 9 Sit-Ups 10. 1 Push-Ups/ 10 Sit-Ups

// Week 4
// Monday
original_workout_week_four_workout~Are you ready to let the dogs out?~This week is the perfect time to test for overall improvement. To do this, start with the warm-up, then repeat week one’s Baseline test, and continue on to the workout.


Baseline Test:


1. Push-Ups or Knee Push-Ups (How many can you get in 1 minute?)
 2. Squat or Chair Squats (How many can you get in 1 minute?)
 3. Plank or Knee Plank (How long can you hold the plank?)


Please post your score at the bottom for benchmarking purposes.


Workout:
 8 Minute Meltdown #2
 *No Equipment Needed


1. Bear Crawl (Forward 10x and Backward 10x)
 2. Seal Jacks or Stationary Jacks (10x)
 3. Hip Pulse (10x)
 4. 3 Push-Ups, 3 Squat Hops or Squats (Repeat circuit 2x)
 5. Ab Crunch (10x)


Post Workout: Core and Stretch

// Wednesday
NA~The Fat Burning 8 Minute Meltdown~*8 Reps of Each Exercise


1) Two Part Exercise: Squat (x2), Push-Ups (x2), Squat (x2), Push-Ups (x2)
 2) Double Ab Crunch
 3) Mt. Climbers (double count)
 4) Ball Slams
 5) Suspension Trainer Pull-Ups
 6) Russian Twists
 7) Gate Swings
 8) Pogo Hops



Core workout from the tab
 Fitness Challenge:
 Complete Exercises For Time:
 How many reps and rounds can you complete in 5 minutes?


1. Burpees (10x)
 2. Australian Pull-Ups (10x)
 3. Mt. Climbers (30x)

Stretch and Cool Down Post Workout:
 Way to work this Workout Anywhere Wednesday. Please post below.

// Week 5
// Monday
original_workout_week_five_workout~Welcome To Week 5: Be Sure to Turn On Beast Mode This Week!~One round and you must complete all reps per exercise before moving onto the next exercise.


Intermediate: 50 Reps / Advanced: 100 Reps
 Equipment recommended: medicine ball


1. Jumping Jacks or Stationary Jacks
 2. Toe Touch Ab Crunch or crunches
 3. Squats or Chair Squats
 4. Side To Side Push-Ups or Knee Push-Ups
 5. Ball Slams or Squats/Chair Squats


Post Workout: Core and Stretch

NA~8 Minute Meltdown ~8 Reps of Each Exercise. Try to get as many rounds as possible in within 8 minutes


1) Jump Squats or Squats for (B and I)
 2) Running High Knees or Marching for (B)
 3) Toe Touch Ab Crunch or Crunches for (B)
 4) Tricep Push Up or Knee Tricep Push Ups (B)
 5) Alternating Supermans



Core workout from the tab
 Fitness Challenge:
 The 2 Minute Challenge:
 How many reps can you get?


1. Squats in 2 minutes 2. Hip pulse in 2 minutes 3. Push-ups in 2 minutes
Stretch and Cool Down Post Workout:
 Don’t forget to post your score below! Way to rock it this week!!!

original_workout_week_six_workout~Game Faces On~Rounds For Time #3

 Equipment: Suspension Trainer (or two beach towels)


All Levels: 6 Rounds, 6 Reps, 6 Exercises

 1. Star Jacks or Jumping Jacks (6x)
 2. Push-Ups with Yoga Twist or Knee Push-Ups (6x)
 3. Planks with Side Toe Taps (6x/side)
 4. Gate Swings (6x)
 5. Australian Pull-Ups (6x)
 6. Alternating Lunges (6x/side)


Post Workout: Core and Stretch

NA~The Anywhere Home/Travel Workout~
Intermediate: 2-3 Rounds
 Advanced: 3-4 Rounds


1. Jumping Jacks (20x)
 2. Hand Release Push-Ups (20x)
 3a. Fire Hydrants (15x)
 3b. Fire Hydrant Circles (15x)
 3c. Fire Hydrant Circles (opposite way) (15x)
 4. Bent Over Back Row w/ Resistance Bands (15x)
 5. Alternating Lunges w/ Shoulder Raise (30x total)
 6. Ab Crunches w/ Medicine Ball (50x)

NA~Welcome To Week 8. Are You Ready For Your Test Bueller?~ Week 8 is the perfect time for a couple re-tests. You have performed admirably throughout the trainer, and now is the time to see the hard work pay off.


To test overall improvement. Repeat week one’s Baseline test, and Week 4’s workout. Hopefully you posted your scores in the comments or group page as a benchmark. If not, no biggy, but you should start for more validation of your hard work.


Step 1: Warm-Up


Step 2: Baseline Test:
 1. Push-Ups or Knee Push-Ups (How many can you get in 1 minute?)

 3. Plank or Knee Plank (How long can you hold the plank?)

 4. 3 Push-Ups, 3 Squat Hops or Squats (Repeat circuit 2x)
 5. Ab Crunch (10x)

// Friday
original_workout_week_twelve_workout~Can You Believe It; You’re Almost Through The First Phase Of The Healthy Lifestyle Formula!~ Great job on making it through the Twelve Week Trainer. We know you have one more day, but your just about there. So, needless to say, congratulations! All your hard work is paying off! The Twelve Week Trainer is the jump-start to the new, healthier you. However, nothing is permanent yet and for a sustainable, healthy lifestyle, progress is key.


Now that you have a meal planning, food preparation and the model of our workout programming understood and implemented, our other meal plans and workout styles should be applied to your healthier lifestyle. Pick between the Freestyle, Flex, or RundleFit’s picks of the weeks to keep the intensity up and narrowing the gap between you and a sustainable, permanent healthy lifestyle (no rebounds!)


On behalf of Jessica and Justin, thank you for your hard work and discipline. You’re an inspiration to us all!


Now continue on with the workouts and please post, comment and share ;-)


Workout:
One Round. You must complete all reps of the exercise before moving onto the next exercise.

Intermediate: 40x
 Advanced: 70x


1. Squat Jumps or Squats
 2. Push-Ups or Knee Push-Ups
 3. Hip Pulse
 4. Burpees
 5. Double Ab Crunch


Post Workout: Core and Stretch:
 Pick at least 6 stretches and hold for 20-30 seconds each. It’s okay to go through the stretch series a couple times. For an amazing post-workout stretch bonus, try foam rolling.


Be sure to follow-up every workout with a high (lean) protein snack and clean carb (fruit counts depending on which meal-plan you chose). As well, drink plenty of water throughout the day and after workouts.


Follow your nutrition plan exactly and use the recipe board for substitutions for best results. Let us know how we can assist you through your fitness journey. Just remember, nutrition is close to 80% of the physical results, so don’t rely solely on exercise.
